description:
My place is close to Starbucks, Beyoglu, Luke's Lobster, The Loeb Central Park Boathouse, and Felice 83. There are a ton of restaurants and bars on 2nd Avenue just a few steps from my apartment. You’ll love my place because of the coziness, the light, and close access to restaurants/bars, the 4/5/6 trains, and Central Park. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers. Available Queen size air mattress for floor as well.

If you have any questions, I am available via (EMAIL HIDDEN) or by cell phone at (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN).

Second Avenue between 70-86 streets are filled with restaurants and bars. Retail shops are available on 86th Street between 2nd Ave. and Madison. There is a CVS and Duane Reade (Walgreens) one block away. Starbucks is one block away. Central Park and The MET are a 10 minute walk west.

The 4/5/6 trains are located at 77th Street and Lexington or 86th and Lexington. Each direction is a 5 minute walk.

If anyone in the building asks, please say you are a friend of Aubrey Walton.
name: Upper East Side Cozy Studio Apartment
review: A  small cozy studio in a great location for sightseeing -you can walk to the Met and Central Park  or catch the subway a few blocks away. Plenty of shops and restraunts nearby.  The area is nice and  relatively quiet for NYC.
